articles.title: All Mass. residents to get free access to Google AI training classes, Healey says
articles.description:
Gov. Maura Healey, who is increasingly focusing on AI adoption, announced a new partnership with Google.

The post All Mass. residents to get free access to Google AI training classes, Healey says appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Gov. Maura Healey announced free Google AI training for all Massachusetts residents.
The initiative aims to enhance AI skills for thousands of residents statewide.
Training classes will support local workforce development and technology adoption.

articles.title: Charlie McAvoy apologizes for Team USA’s reaction to Trump joke about US women’s team
articles.description:
"Certainly sorry for how we responded to it in that moment."

The post Charlie McAvoy apologizes for Team USA’s reaction to Trump joke about US women’s team appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Charlie McAvoy apologized for Team USA's reaction to Donald Trump's joke about the women's hockey team.
McAvoy expressed regret for the team's response during the Olympics on February 26, 2026.
The incident highlights ongoing tensions between sports figures and political commentary affecting Boston's sports community.

articles.title: Mayor Jake Wilson plans to tackle Somerville’s housing crisis. Will it work?
articles.description:
More density, new zoning, and fresh investment in affordable and social housing top his priorities.

The post Mayor Jake Wilson plans to tackle Somerville’s housing crisis. Will it work? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Mayor Jake Wilson prioritizes increased density and new zoning in Somerville.
Plans include fresh investment in affordable housing to address local shortages.
Residents may see improved housing options and affordability by 2026.

articles.title: Watch this wild (and inspirational) video out of New Bedford following the blizzard
articles.description:
New Bedford’s side streets weren’t fully plowed yet. But that didn’t stop one local man with a pickup truck and determination.

The post Watch this wild (and inspirational) video out of New Bedford following the blizzard appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Local man uses pickup truck to clear New Bedford's unplowed side streets after blizzard.
Video showcases community spirit and determination following the February 2026 snowstorm.
Residents benefit as access improves, highlighting the importance of local support during severe weather.
